snippet: Nationals Manager Davey Johnson said he decided to bench the star right-hander Stephen Strasburg, who had a 15-6 record, because of the distraction caused by his innings limit.
abstract: Washington Nationals shut down pitcher Stephen Strasburg for the season, a day after he gave up five runs in three innings against the Miami Marlins; Nationals manager Davey Johnson says he believes the news media attention surrounding the team-imposed limit on Strasburg after elbow surgery was becoming a distraction and affecting the pitcher's performance.

byline.contributor: Tyler Kepner contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Nationals Manager Davey Johnson said he decided to bench the star right-hander Stephen Strasburg, who had a 15-6 record, because of the distraction caused by his innings limit.

headline.seo: Stephen Strasburg’s Season Ends After 1591/3 Innings
headline.main: Second Guesses Start After Nationals End Strasburg’s Season
headline.print_headline: Second Guesses Start After Nationals End Strasburg’s Season
